title: Continuously crashing due to overheating with other apps
text: It already happened twice this week while using Teams and Google Maps and also with Waze on CarPlay background. Made me loose an important exit üòÖ

title: Add new features
text:
Zoom offers a variety of features that have contributed to its popularity as a video-conferencing tool. Some of the key features include:
Virtual Backgrounds: Allows users to change their background to an image or video during a call.
Keyboard Shortcuts: Provides various shortcuts for actions like muting, starting video, recording, etc.
App Integration: Enables connection with other apps like Google Calendar, Outlook, Slack, etc., for easy scheduling and joining of meetings.
Breakout Rooms: Permits the host to split the meeting into smaller groups for focused discussions.
Polls and Surveys: Facilitates the creation and launching of polls and surveys during meetings for interactive feedback.
Screen Sharing: Allows sharing of the screen or a specific window with participants.
Chat and Reactions: Offers chat messaging and the use of emojis and gestures for reactions.

But I‚Äôm sure that these things will be integrated in a better capacity. I‚Äôm liking it so far I‚Äôm using it for work and it has been beneficial. Nice going Microsoft. I had lost my faith in you, but you guys are slowly what surely regaining it to see greater integration in Windows 12.

title: Great communication tool.
text: Allows our organization to communicate effectively between departments so everyone gets vital updates

title: Why is the badge notification so utterly useless? It‚Äôs wrong 90% of the time.
text: The rest of the app is pretty good but the useless badging drives me nuts. It constantly shows some number, but when I open the app there actually are zero new notifications.

title: Apple CarPlay bug
text: Previous versions had great CarPlay integration for chats, where Siri would read your messages to you. This no longer works. Please fix.

title: Phantom Notifications
text:
I have a constant notification in my badge app icon, and I‚Äôve check every spot that could possibly have a notification. I‚Äôve used the ‚Äúmark all as read‚Äù option, and well as reinstalling the app, restarting my phone, logging out then in again. It goes away for a little while when I do those things, but it always comes back. It reads different number each time too, it was at a constant 17 for a little while, now it‚Äôs at 1. It‚Äôs all very annoying, and I can never tell if I have a new message or not. 

Otherwise, the app works fine.  I haven‚Äôt had any issues transferring from my computer to phone and vice-versa. I haven‚Äôt set up meeting through the app, but I have been able to access files, as long as they are in the ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù folder (I also find that a little frustrating, we sometime have things in ‚ÄúDocuments‚Äù instead).

title: Works great
text: Haven‚Äôt had a problem yet been using it for a few weeks and it‚Äôs a great app

title: It‚Äôs a bit confusing

title: It‚Äôs ok - Status NEVER Accurate
text: Status states are never accurate and are not trustworthy or reliable

title: Decent app but could use more Messenger style features
text: Decent app but could us more messenger like features and capabilities and the option to choose the profile picture you want for that person to make it easier to track people or teams. Or at least customize it. And other superficial issues with personalization and features. It would be nice to have a more organize or visually distinguishing platform for your favorites for they are more separated form the rest of the messages. And more ability to customize your view. Features are awesome, but the ease of using them and now aesthetically pleasing they are in the most simple way matters. And Dark mode could have more color options also.
